response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<Shape> it = shapes.iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
  Shape shape = it.next();
  shape.printMe(numbers.get(i));
}
<<<explanation>>>: You're creating a new shapes.iterator() in every iteration of your loop. Try to just use the value of the foreach inside the loop.
Question: How to get the value of a key in a JSONObject?: :I'm trying to get the value of a key in a JSONObject. I've tried using JSONObject.get(key) but it doesn't work.
Please using this api: JSONObject.get(key).
Answer:<<<api>>>: JSONObject.get(key)
<<<code>>>: JSONObject jsonObject = new JSONObject(jsonString);
String value = jsonObject.get(key);
<<<explanation>>>: You can use JSONObject.get(key) to get the value of a key in a JSONObject.
